text:
Ole Miss self-imposes one-year postseason ban following NCAA investigation Christopher Hanewinckel/Christopher Hanewinckel-USA TODA Feb 22, 2017 at 5:27p ET 0Shares 
Ole Miss announced Wednesday that it will self-impose a one-year postseason ban for 2017 after an NCAA investigation uncovered 21 allegations of violations made by the football program. 
Among the violations found by the NCAA is a lack of institutional control â€” a charge which the school plans to fight, according to a video statement released by Ole Miss Chancellor Jeffrey Vitter, Vice Chancellor of Athletics Ross Bjork and head football coach Hugh Freeze. 
The rebels will also forefit its annual SEC postseason money, which is approximately $7.8 million, as per league rules.
